topic_name: Flying and spying: A Renaissance dream comes true
image_credits: Canaletto, Piazza San Marco with the Basilica, Venice, 1723. Oil on canvas. Ricardo Brennand Institute, Recife, Brazil
og_name: Flying and spying: A Renaissance dream comes true
og_description: The popular trend for drones has highlighted an old human desire: to see the world from above and look upon the lives of those below. But how was this desire satisfied before modern flying and spying? Historian Zolt치n Biedermann takes us to Renaissance Italy to find an earlier form of voyeurism.
